headline.main: SHIP ARMING TALK CONTINUES TODAY; President Enlarges Conference Group, Adding Rayburn and McCormack to Advisers PANAMA'S ACTION A SPUR Agreement on Administration's 'Strategy' in Effecting Revision of Law Is Predicted

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 -- Fresident Roosevelt, his conviction of the necessity for rapid revision of the American Neutrality Act strengthened by the action of Panama in forbidding the arming of foreign-owned ships operating under its registry, called today for a second "strategy" meeting of Congressional leaders and administrative advisers at the White House at 10 A.M. tomorrow.
abstract: bipartisan conf; list; illus; Speaker Rayburn and Repr McCormack asked to join group in 2d conf; Sen Barkley says Roosevelt will send message to Cong; Hull urges revision or repeal
